newsitem.title: GERMANY: SAP shares eyed for boost from results.
newsitem.headline: SAP shares eyed for boost from results.

text.p: Shares in German software group SAP AG were expected to climb higher on Thursday after the company said it hoped to exceed 1997 sales growth targets with the strong dollar boosting profits.

SAP shares were trading at 434.00 marks, up 1.20 marks from its close in electronic trading on Wednesday, when the company said first half sales rose 51 percent to 2.4 billion marks and pretax profit increased 56 percent to 582 million marks.
"In the long view, they could get to 500 if the stock market stays positive," said Hans Peter Wodniok at Credit Lyonnais in Frankfurt.

The share's course in the near term was harder to predict because it is not clear how long the blue-chip DAX index can maintain the staggering rally that began at the beginnign of the year, Wodniok said.

The share was likely to be buoyed by today's news as well as by an analyst meeting on Friday that could prompt some investment houses to upgrade ratings on the stock, said Wodniok, who planned to upgrade as a result of the positive news.
"That could give a boost to the stock," he said.
Juergen Hackenberg at Deutsche Morgan Grennfell earlier this week told Reuters he was waiting to hear the company's results before sending out a new research note on SAP.
